result.execSummary:
The defendant Noah J. Cornwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Noah J. Cornwell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
1:42 p.m. Defendant Noah J. Cornwell in court with attorney Timothy S. Gebert. Defendant Noah J. Cornwell in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have received and reviewed the PSI report. No corrections needed.  State complied with victim notification statutes. Cases heard today are 15CF11 and 15CF44. ADA Cousins states sentencing recommendations for a prison sentence for both cases at 20 months Incarceration and 25 months Extended Supervision, consecutive to each other with same conditions as listed in the PSI report.
2:04 p.m. Atty Gebert states sentencing recommendations for probation for 5 or 6 yrs with conditions.
2:10 p.m. Defendant makes apologetic statements.

BTC: *****PRISON****
15CF11 Count 1: 20 months Incarceration and 25 months Extended Supervision (239 days credit)
No contact with Daniel Franck.
No contact with Eleanor Horvath, unless it is approved in advance by Ms. Horvath and the agent. 
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
 Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business (Court will not allow to work as a bartender).  
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Complete a psychological assessment and comply with recommendations.
Compy with anger management and/or domestic abuse counseling.
Comply with any other assessments, treatment, and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and the Dept of Corrections.
Sign relase of information forms for assessments, medication/pharmacy(ies) and /or treatment.
Provide agent with list of all medications prescribed.
All prescription medications must come from one pharmacy.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Provide DNA sample.
Pay costs + DNA surcharge.
Payment plan and pay resitution of $11,561.73.
Pay all court ordered financial obligations in full 90 days prior to discharge.
Pay Restitution and costs and 25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Not eligible for challenge or early release programs.


15CF44 Count 1: I/S sentence: 20 months Incarceration and 25 months Extended Supervision, consecutive to 15CF11 - Stayed
 5 yrs probation, consecutive to 15CF11 same conditions as 15CF11
Pay costs + DNA surcharge.

Written Determinate sentence paper provided.
and Addendum to PSI - Original filed in 15CF11
Plea questionnaire, waiver of rights - original filed in 15CF11

Defendant Noah J. Cornwell in court with attorney Timothy S. Gebert. Defendant Noah J. Cornwell in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF11, 15CF44
2:03 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
  
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF11 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
15CF44 Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

Atty Gebert agrees with the Domestic Repeater statute.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF11 Count 1, 15CF44 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF44 Counts 2 thru 4 are dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders a PSI. 
Bond Continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 27, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Noah J. Cornwell in court with attorney Timothy S. Gebert. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Noah J. Cornwell in court with attorney Timothy S. Gebert. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:52 a.m. case is called. 15CF11 & 15CF44
Address is verified.  3241 Village Lane, Plover, WI  54467 - mother's residence
This matter is before the court for the defendant's motion for modification of bond and preliminary hearing.  

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing.   Court accepts the waiver and bounds the defendant over for trial.

Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Bond Continued.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Court informs the defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Court accepts the NG plea to all charges in both files.

MOTION HEARING
Attorney Gebert states its position as to modification of bond.  
ADA states the victims have been notified.  
Victim, Ms. Horvath makes statement to the court.  Would like No contact lifted and bond modification granted.  
Court questions whether she has gone to Family Crisis for safety plan.  Victim makes additional statement.  

ADA Cousins makes statement in opposition of modification of bond.  

The court reviewed the complaint in each files and heard the statement of the victim.  

BTC:  
Motion is denied.  

11:07 p.m.  case is concluded.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 23, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
